sub: You have the key and cupboard from the novel/film The Indian in the Cupboard
com:
After placing a toy, model, figure, or sculpture of any kind into the cupboard and closing the door, you insert the key into the lock and twist. When you open the door once again, your inanimate object will be alive!

The rules are:
>The toy(s) must reasonably fit within pic related
>The toy(s) you animate will remain at their toy size - converted to living flesh, clothing, or whatever material the original character was made out of
>The toy(s) will be completely sentient and alive, with their own thoughts and emotions (Unless it is a toy of a non-sentient object like a weapon, vehicle, or prop)
>They will retain their canon personality and abilities, along with any memories they have of their non-toy lives up to that point - including relationships and enemies
>Whatever accessories they had on them will be recreated at that scale as well (Plastic turns into wood, steel, fictional material, etc.)
>If they are not from a work of fiction, they will assume they are a real individual from whatever era the toy represents (i.e. Little Bear, an Iroquois Chief, and Tommy Atkins, a WWII English army medic, from the book and movie)
>Construction/creative materials such as Play-Doh, Lego, or Meccano will become whatever the creator meant them to be when constructing them
>Blank slate/custom toy characters (Lego minifigures, custom-painted miniatures, wooden mannequins) will become whatever the creator imagined for them

Whenever you choose to reverse the process, they become a toy again and their consciousness returns to wherever it belongs.

>If a friend makes something out of Play-Doh or modelling putty but I have no idea what it is, will it become what they intended it to be if I put it in? What if I put it in, but think it's something other then what it is? Like say they made what's suppose to be a book, but I think it looks like a a folded up blanket? Will it come out as a book like they intended it to be, or as blankets like I mistook it for?
>What if I make a toy real and then get them to make something out of putty/clay/doh? Could I then make it real? What if they lied and told me that they were medical tools, but they were in fact weapons and I didn't know? OP here.

I sculpt and since I use soft Chavant some seperate parts fall apart with the slightest movement.

So I was thinking about using some pins however stabbing yourself or cutting your finger on a wire pin is not fun.

So I was thinking about toy parts and lego since the pins must be hard and durable and not shatter into a 1000 peaces to ruin my clay (3D printed parts).

So the best option is for these pins to be smooth and have nothing the clay can grab on (that small technique peace that is a cylinder with holes in it is problematic since it will forever take clay into itself) So i need something smooth to not grab clay and that I can clean to not lose clay.

Also these pins have benefits since I intend to 3D scan my best works and and dissembling the model using a pin system is a great idea for a quick parts scan.

The color is because black is extra hard to 3D scan and red also now creates problems. This is also why I say no to shiny or transparent pins since they can confuse the 3D scanner.

Any suggestions of what I can use ?

I finally opened them seeing the post. Motivation to unbox is low with reissues so they sat there for a while. I got two since I was confident Kaiyodo wouldn't make the same mistake twice with the same figure. They make the same mistakes with different figures...but not the same figure as far as I can recall.

Short answer, everything feels right. BUT plasticizer leakage isn't exactly positive/negative result out of the box either. But few factors indicate for me this one should be fine, far better than original release for sure even at worst case.

First of all, the paint quality is much better. They're evenly spread, no differentiation in hues, and probably less misplaced spots too. Original was rough there already. Main cause for the paint pealing off I bet because it was such a shit job even without plasticizer problem. That alone is worth getting the reissue.

Another good sign was that none of the parts in contact were stuck. Sure there are plastic keeping some body parts separate but they don't cover everything. Nothing felt like it got dislodged when moving the figures the first time. Original had some serious stuck paint and transferred paint out of the box.

Last point is something that concerns me. The reissue still have some softer PVC parts, which increases likelihood of plasticizer leakage since that's used to make the plastic and paint softer and stretchier. Only for say the gauntlets and crotch piece though, they MIGHT get sticky in years, maybe climate dependent.

If you're unsure I say definitely risk it and get the reissue. AY is probably the best Iron Man figure at this size and price range so you shouldn't miss out on it at it's full potential. It took a while for a proper reissue so might take longer for another one.

>>10176119
Google my friend. Plenty of tutorials, videos, info all over the internet thats way more in depth and with pics/videos than anyone here can give.

Short answer: Apoxie sculpt or something to fill in the back of the head and sculpt the backside. Silicone rubber to make the mold within the lego brick enclosure. Some kind of urethane resin for the casts depending on how hard/flexible you want them (Smooth-On is used for buying silicone and resins for many). For color matching, painting will be the easiest unless you dye the resin but that's insanely difficult to color match while mixing resins.

Also, people practicing molding and casting for MONTHS or YEARS sometimes before perfecting it, and there's often lots of expensive materials you'll need to get perfect looking casts or molds. (Vacuum chamber, pressure pot, high quality silicone and resins) Don't expect to jump into this as a total noob and be able to make great casts.

name: Morphine-Kun
com:
Welcome back everyone, hope you're all doing well.

The time has come for us to finally have new releases in the line! By now most of everyone who ordered Olivier and Vania should have them in hand. Its seems the delay was worth it as Olivier seems to be one of the better releases in the line. Vania also seems to be a generally good release as people are having fun messing with her and Olivier. As of now, we only have one other figure up for Pre-Order right now, that being Bikini Clover. Currently we know that the Polynian and Touhou series will continue since Marisa is supposedly the next in line to go up. The official Poly 4Koma is still going and it seems its been well received as it gives little look into the everyday lives of the Polys we know. We also had a wonderful surprise in the form of the new Polynian MLL body! We finally have a counterpart to the Iana body. Aside from that things have been pretty quiet for the time being.

As always, here is the assistance e-mail for those who need it, so if any problem should arise, feel free to contact them over at "user_support@mile-stone.jp" or the shop you purchased the figure from.

Once again, feel free to share your photos and adventures, they add life and some fun to the thread. Also, welcome newcomers, we hope you enjoy your stay.

>GO look at fucking Tron
Once again picture rendering is radically different from sculpting that uses simple G-code
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G-code
G-code arrived in the 1950 literally indicating that it was even used in the 1960s.

Of course this would be used for more technical applications like mechanical parts and technical things.

>also afford the computers needed and export it to make a mold

>also afford the computers needed and export it to make a mold

Not a 1970s factory CNC expert. However what you would have is a computer (the size of 2 refrigerators (DPD-11)) connected to industrial machinery.

And this is enough if the software understands basic 3D shape operations like
>Drill a cylinder of depth 0.5mm
a PDP-11 r even more early computers can do that.
A int variable can hold about a max value of 2,147,483,647 this means that the software can have a range of 2 METERS x 2 METERS with a precision of 0.000001mm using 2 int variables. It is a simple mathematical operation to check if the drill head is inside a predefined cube or cylinder this way.
